title: Analysis of g based on analytical info for g' and g''

content.question: The function g is defined for x > 0 with g (1) = 2, g' ( x ) = sin( x + 1/ x ), and g'' ( x ) = (1 - 1 / x 2 )cos( x + 1/ x ). (a) Find all values of x in the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0.12</mn> <mtext> </mtext> <mo>≤</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>x</mi> <mtext> </mtext> <mo>≤</mo> <mtext> 1</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@407F@</annotation> </semantics> </math> at which the graph of g has a horizontal tangent line.

frqParts.text: The function g is defined for x > 0 with g (1) = 2, g' ( x ) = sin( x + 1/ x ), and g'' ( x ) = (1 - 1 / x 2 )cos( x + 1/ x ). (a) Find all values of x in the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0.12</mn> <mtext> </mtext> <mo>≤</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>x</mi> <mtext> </mtext> <mo>≤</mo> <mtext> 1</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@407F@</annotation> </semantics> </math> at which the graph of g has a horizontal tangent line.
(b) On what subintervals of (0.12, 1), if any, is the graph of g concave down? Justify your answer.
(c) Write an equation for the line tangent to the graph of g at x = 0.3.
(d) Does the line tangent to the graph of g at x = 0.3 lie above or below the graph of g for 0.3 < x < 1? Why?

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
